meanings.definition: The study of musical instruments and their classification.
meanings.sent1: In his organologies class, he learned about different types of musical instruments.
meanings.sent2: She conducted research in organologies to understand how musical instruments are categorized.
meanings.sent3: The organologies professor played a tune on each instrument to demonstrate their unique sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of organologies was like a symphony, harmoniously blending different instrument types.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on organologies made the study of musical instruments come alive with vivid descriptions.

meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the structure and function of organs.
meanings.sent1: Organologies explores how organs work together in living organisms.
meanings.sent2: Biologists use organologies to study the functions of different body parts.
meanings.sent3: The organologies professor dressed up as a giant heart to teach about organs in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of organologies in the human body is like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: Through vivid illustrations, the book explained the intricate details of organologies in biology.

meanings.definition: The systematic study of organs and their functions.
meanings.sent1: Doctors rely on organologies to understand how organs function in the body.
meanings.sent2: The course on organologies covered the roles of different organs in maintaining health.
meanings.sent3: The organologies lab experiment involved studying the functions of various organs under a microscope.
meanings.sent4: The interconnectedness of organs in organologies is like a complex network of roads in a city.
meanings.sent5: Through hands-on activities, students were able to grasp the concepts of organologies more effectively.
